hedline.hl1: This Time, Consumers Get To Pick the Winning Ad

block.p: Asking consumers to help create commercials is a hot trend in advertising. Now, the public is being invited for the first time to choose the winner of an advertising award.

The One Club for Art and Copy in New York has put up a Web site (oneshow.tv) where consumers can select their favorite commercial from among the spots from 2006 that are finalists for awards. At the One Show awards ceremony on May 9, the commercial with the most consumer votes will receive a People's Choice Award, said Mary Warlick, executive director of the club.
Asking consumers to help create commercials is a hot trend in advertising. Now, the public is being invited for the first time to choose the winner of an advertising award.

The One Club for Art and Copy in New York has put up a Web site (oneshow.tv) where consumers can select their favorite commercial from among the spots from 2006 that are finalists for awards. At the One Show awards ceremony on May 9, the commercial with the most consumer votes will receive a People's Choice Award, said Mary Warlick, executive director of the club.

If the creators of the public's favorite spot are not among the winners of awards chosen by the show's professional judges, Ms. Warlick said, they will be invited to the ceremony to receive their prize.
